statement.p: Elongation measures the amount a metal sample stretches under carefully applied force. It is used to measure how ductile (stretchable) that type of metal is. \displaystyle{E}=\frac{{{D}-{C}}}{{C}}\times{100}. C is the original gage length, and D is the gage length after the pull. The times 100 is to make it a percent.
If \displaystyle{C}={6} and \displaystyle{D}={12} what is the elongation?
